He twists his shoulders and relaxes his arms. They both f towards the spike but John angles himself, missing it and SLASHING THE BACK OF JANE’'S SHOULDER. She gasps in pain. dialogues.text: You always ask if-

Flying backward high-speed into... The barrel of a gun. A quick flash of an EYE IN THE SCOPESIGHT. JANE’S EYE.

dialogues.text: T‘ll get a towel-

dialogues.text: You lied to me. She drops a gear and floors it. The engine roars. John PUNCHES the gas harder. Weaving. He catches up to he They SWERVE toward each other.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don't dent the Honda. Don’t dent the fuckin’ Honda. Fighting for a lane, Their CARS bump and grind. SPARKS FL

dialogues.text: Shit. He’s armed. She reaches under her seat and pulls out a Sig and high capacity clip. She locks and loads. John looks across.

On impact, he accidently squeezes off a round 9mill slug ZINGS through his windscreen, through ten feet freezing country air, and through the Honda’s rear window

dialogues.text: You bastard! She swivels in her seat and empties Ten Massive .45 calib rounds behind her which SING into John's car. John eats passenger seat, showered with proken glass.

It hits the center of Jane's windshield EXPLODING impact, wreathing her hood in flames. Jane can't see for fire. She stays cool, hunching down in seat, swapping her hand for her foot on the gas. She brac both feet against the windshield and KICKS, it neatly pop out. John sees the flaming glass cartwheel toward him. He BRAK HARD, as it catches his side door. Jane smiles. Frustrated, John FLOORS IT. Side by side, they lock eyes 125MPH. A flicker of...electricity...attraction? John sho

He SLA INTO THE RAMP WALL. CRASHING through the concrete, He swallows hard, shutting his eyes. As his car goes AIRBORNE! FLYING OFF THE RAMP, SOARING THROUGH THE NIGHT. NOSE-DIVING into the Hudson. IMPACT. SPLASH! The car sinks fast. LIGHT hits the water. Jane stands on bank: police maglight on her left shoulder, pistol in her right hand sweeping the river. No sign of John. A beat. Still no John. No bubbles... She hears SIRENS. COPS incom With a last glance at the river, Jane drives into the nig

dialogues.text: Water swirls. Beyond the waves...on the other side of a r old buoy... John bebs. Alive, His eyes flash. Not so much angry as... IMPRESSED. Impassioned. Ready for war. We hear a DING DONG on the CUT TO--

dialogues.text: What the hell happened to you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: My wife. John heads inside. Leaving Eddie, mouth open.

dialogues.speaker: JASMINE
dialogues.text: OK. Say that again.
John sits opposite Eddie at the little breakfast table. E leoks like he’s digesting an albatross.

dialogues.text: No I mean really. What are the chances of that happening?

dialogues.text: Well it’s happened.

dialogues.text: Se she was doing this from the start?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I cannot believe that woman.

dialogues.text: How many people you do think she’s killed?

dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.text: Well do you think she's killed more than you? I mean she could have, She could have killed way more.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Goddamn it Eddie. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Well one of you has, and it could be her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Eddie, please. John is dealing.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: How d‘you suppose she kept it from you all these years?

dialogues.speaker: JORN
dialogues.text: Lots of couples have secrets.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. Lots of couples have dogs. What you got is a fuckin’ Tyranosaurus Rex. John stares at the table.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I can‘t believe she lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You weren‘t. exactly playin‘ straight yourself.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's completely different. I married that woman because I loved her.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Well do you still love her? Wait don’t answer that. You should sleep on this. You're both upset.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Upset? My wife wants to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: That’s not so unusual.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She fired fifteen shots into my car and drove me off the road into the Hudson. $2. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Okay, that less usual. But trust me. Right now she’s probably as confused as you are. Hurt. Vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She didn’t seem too vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: dust get some sleep, and in the morning go see her. Talk to her, buy some flowers, be nice to her...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You don’t understand Eddie. She ID'd me. On a hit. Get it? Eddie’s expression darkens. John nods. Eddie exhales shak his head. John is in ten kinds of agony. They both clearl know what this means. It's heavy. Really heavy.

dialogues.text: Fresh carpet of snow. A PAPERBOY pedals his bike, throwin papers. A paper hits the SMITH HOUSE. A picture-perfect h

dialogues.text: Having second thoughts...? Jane looks up. She tries to cover. Cool, professional.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: i'm just checking the personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: JASMINE
dialogues.text: Find anything...personal? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No leads. The mark covered his tracks. Jasmine gets close. She picks up an old photo.

dialogues.text: The "mark"? He’s your husband, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I don’t know WHO he is. Jane's voice rose. She catches herself. Composes herself.

dialogues.text: He's a security risk, he knows me, he's compromised everyone here.

dialogues.speaker: JASMINE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Are you sure you aren’t compromising everyone now? Jane opens her mouth. But there is no easy answer this ti

dialogues.speaker: JASMINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, you're not the first girl in the world to find out her life's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I thought it was my lie. INT. SMITH HOUSE — UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - DAY Jane drifts through empty halls. Looking at her home...as for the first time. She stops at a photo of her and John smiling at Coney Island. She hardens. And hears HER VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN AND JANE ON TV. Jane‘s Associates sit on the bed, watching VACATION VIDEOS. John and Jane dance on a beach.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Looks like your honeymoo- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: I know what it is. What are you doing with it?!

dialogues.text: Research. Background. On the target.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
